channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Russia, Iran and China are all trying to sway American voters this election
item.description: America's geopolitical adversaries, particularly Russia, Iran and China, have been active in trying to influence the election, as part of their larger goals to sow chaos and discredit democracy.
item.content:encoded:
America's geopolitical adversaries, particularly Russia, Iran and China, have been active in trying to influence the election, as part of their larger goals to sow chaos and discredit democracy.

(Image credit: Brian Munoz)
item.dc:creator: Shannon Bond

item.title: Which states are swing states? Here are the results to watch this year
item.description: Seven states have been the focus for pollsters and campaigns in this presidential election: The "Blue Wall" and the Sun Belt.
item.content:encoded:
Seven states have been the focus for pollsters and campaigns in this presidential election: The "Blue Wall" and the Sun Belt.

(Image credit: Gregory Shamus)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Jim Justice wins West Virginia Senate race, flipping seat for Republicans
item.description: West Virginia Gov. Jim Justice has won the state’s open Senate seat, according to a race call by the Associated Press, giving Republicans a boost in their fight to regain control of the chamber.
item.content:encoded:
West Virginia Gov. Jim Justice has won the state’s open Senate seat, according to a race call by the Associated Press, giving Republicans a boost in their fight to regain control of the chamber.

(Image credit: Justin Merriman)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Hurricane Rafael forms in the Caribbean Sea and expected to enter the Gulf of Mexico
item.description: An active 2024 Atlantic Hurricane season continues as Rafael strengthens into a category 1 storm. It's expected to batter Cayman Islands and Cuba before swinging into the Gulf of Mexico.
item.content:encoded:
An active 2024 Atlantic Hurricane season continues as Rafael strengthens into a category 1 storm. It's expected to batter Cayman Islands and Cuba before swinging into the Gulf of Mexico.

(Image credit: National Hurricane Center)
item.dc:creator: Russell Lewis

item.title: You've heard of swing states. Here are 7 swing counties to watch
item.description: Here seven counties to watch — one in each swing state — that might give some idea how the race is going and why one candidate or the other won:
item.content:encoded:
Here seven counties to watch — one in each swing state — that might give some idea how the race is going and why one candidate or the other won:

(Image credit: Scott Olson)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Republican Mike Braun wins Indiana governor’s race
item.description: The first-term senator’s campaign pitch centered on his experience starting and growing an auto parts business into a multi-million-dollar company.
item.content:encoded:
The first-term senator’s campaign pitch centered on his experience starting and growing an auto parts business into a multi-million-dollar company.

(Image credit: Aaron P. Bernstein)
item.dc:creator: Brandon Smith, Indiana Public Broadcasting

item.title: Photos: See what Election Day looked like across the country
item.description: The final day of election season is coming to an end as polling stations around the U.S. close. See what Election Day looked like across the country.
item.content:encoded:
The final day of election season is coming to an end as polling stations around the U.S. close. See what Election Day looked like across the country.

(Image credit: Tyrone Turner)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Hours are extended for certain Georgia polling places after threats
item.description: Voting hours have been extended by up to 45 minutes at five locations in Georgia's Fulton County, after hoax bomb threats that officials tied to Russian sources.
item.content:encoded:
Voting hours have been extended by up to 45 minutes at five locations in Georgia's Fulton County, after hoax bomb threats that officials tied to Russian sources.

(Image credit: John Bazemore)
item.dc:creator: Benjamin Swasey

item.title: Follow NPR for 2024 election night coverage
item.description: Tune in to NPR starting at 7 p.m. ET on Nov. 5 as polls begin to close, and stay with us throughout the night as results come in.
item.content:encoded: Tune in to NPR starting at 7 p.m. ET on Nov. 5 as polls begin to close, and stay with us throughout the night as results come in.
item.dc:creator: Heidi Glenn

item.title: Baby black-footed ferrets first to be born to a cloned mom
item.description: Black-footed ferrets are one of the most endangered mammals in North America with only an estimated 370 in the wild, according to the World Wildlife Fund.
item.content:encoded:
Black-footed ferrets are one of the most endangered mammals in North America with only an estimated 370 in the wild, according to the World Wildlife Fund.

(Image credit: Smithsonian’s National Zoo and Conservation Biology Institute)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz
